title: [Large-Scale] Example- and Problem-Based Learning Design for Acquiring Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Ability to Analyze Social Phenomena and Digital Device Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Learners autonomously select digital learning materials and acquire social problem-solving skills through project execution. Learning outcomes are measured via comprehensive assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze various social issue cases and derive at least three core causes
Learners can explain problem-solving strategies step-by-step using provided examples (video/text)
Learners can apply problem-solving procedures in real project situations and propose concrete solutions
Learners can select tasks according to complexity levels (Level 1–3) and self-regulate their learning process

resources: Database of over 45 assignments (video examples, task examples, practice problems)
Social issue case studies by complexity level (Level 1–3)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
